node.title: Court expected to rule if Russian teen sensation can continue.
node.description: Court expected to rule if Russian teen Valieva can continue. The Russian coach of the 15-year-old figure skater embroiled in an Olympic doping scandal has broken her silence to defend...

node.title: Transcript: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy that aired Sunday, February 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Kinzinger says January 6 committee "fully" expects Giuliani's cooperation
node.description: The committee asked Giuliani to turn over documents by February 1 and testify February 8.

node.title: Declaring ‘zero tolerance,’ the police cleared the blockade at a vital Canadian-U.S. crossing.
node.description: Officials say traffic can resume over the Ambassador Bridge once conditions are deemed safe.

node.title: Ryan Fox wins Ras Al Khaimah Classic
node.description: The Auckland golfer fired a three under par final round to finish at 22 under, winning the Ras Al Khaimah Classic in the UAE by five shots.

node.title: Photo essay: Parliament grounds occupation
node.description: Images from the sixth day of the protest against the government's Covid-19 restrictions outside Parliament in Wellington.

node.title: Transcript: San Francisco Fed CEO Mary Daly on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Mary Daly, the president and CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, that aired Sunday, February 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Here’s how to watch ice dancing (during and after the Super Bowl).
node.description: Or if you’re really enterprising, you can watch both.

node.title: Covid-19: Restrictions under red traffic light 'take their toll' on SMEs
node.description: Nearly a third of small and medium sized businesses are experiencing a drop in sales since the country moved into the red Covid-19 traffic light setting.

node.title: Champions Chelsea add another trophy
node.description: Chelsea have lifted the FIFA Club World Cup for the first time after an extra-time win against Brazilian club Palmeiras.

node.title: Heavy snowfall hits Winter Olympics
node.description: While athletes have been competing on artificial snow throughout the Beijing Olympics, organisers are now dealing with the logistical challenge of clearing away the real thing.

node.title: Government gives $200k to South Island flood cleanup effort
node.description: [b]  The Government is giving 200,000 dollars to the West Coast and the top of the South Island to help with the cleanup from two large floods in recent weeks.

node.title: Art vending machine a first for Southern Hemisphere
node.description: A re-purposed vending machine which dispenses art was installed this week in Christchurch's Art Centre.

node.title: One person dead in Temuka crash
node.description: Police have confirmed one person has died and another has been injured in a crash in Temuka near Timaru.

node.title: North Island power outages to continue overnight as tropical low hits
node.description: Thousands of North Island homes are likely to be without power tonight, following gale-force winds that damaged lines and brought down trees.

node.title: Transcript: Representative Adam Kinzinger on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with GOP Representative Adam Kinzinger of Illinois that aired Sunday, February 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Super Bowl Sunday: Jim Gaffigan on the pageantry and the gluttony
node.description: The "Sunday Morning" commentator opines on today's very American holiday – a mix of blood-pumping patriotism, violence and commercials, enhanced with foods we actually enjoy.

node.title: Transcript: Jake Sullivan on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan that aired Sunday, February 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Scott Gottlieb that aired Sunday, February 13, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: A "dating app" for zoo populations
node.description: Data from zoos and aquariums across North America is being used to create matches for breeding – an animal dating app, if you will – to help species survive while maintaining genetic diversity.

node.title: I'm still Chevy Chase, and you're not
node.description: Even at 78, a year to the week after a near-fatal heart failure, the comedian is serving up improvisation about his rise from breakout "Saturday Night Live" cast member to star of a string of classic comic films.

node.title: Police arrest remaining protesters at U.S.-Canada bridge
node.description: Television images showed police arresting the few protesters who remained just after dawn near the Ambassador Bridge.

node.title: Poll: Most Americans have experienced true love in their lives
node.description: About half say true love was different from what they expected.

node.title: Do you believe in true love?
node.description: A photographer, romance novelist, screenwriter and psychologist answer an age-old question; talk about the stages of love (lust, romantic obsession, and attachment); and discuss how to keep love alive.

node.title: New York's sweetest shop: Selling candy since 1937
node.description: At Economy Candy, a third-generation shop on Manhattan's Lower East Side, it's impossible not to feel like a kid in a candy store, faced with thousands of varieties of sweets.

node.title: CBS News poll: U.S. efforts on COVID, economy are better, not yet good
node.description: There is still support for mask requirements amid some frustration.

node.title: Double proxy weddings: Getting hitched in Montana without being there
node.description: A quirky Montana law allows residents or active service members to get married without even setting foot in the state. Now, double proxy weddings - where two stand-ins say "I do" on behalf of absent couples - have become a big business.

node.title: The agony of defeat: Lessons from football fandom
node.description: Loss, whether in football or politics, is never easy. Sports fans, however, may offer a civics lesson on accepting a heart-wrenching outcome.

node.title: How lawyers' TV ads became a billion-dollar industry
node.description: It was once a crime for lawyers to hawk their services. How did commercials selling legal advice become so pervasive – and so bonkers?

node.title: Erin Jackson becomes first Black woman to win speedskating gold
node.description: Jackson's gold came after teammate Brittany Bowe gave up her spot on the team​ to ensure Jackson would get to skate in Beijing.
